paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 gene, its role in homologous recombination, and mentions a specific cancer-associated mutant D2723H, but does not provide detailed variant data or penetrance information.

patients.phenotype: mislocalized to the cytoplasm due to an aberrantly exposed nuclear export signal

individual_records.phenotype_details: mislocalized to the cytoplasm due to an aberrantly exposed nuclear export signal
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Moreover, a cancer-associated mutant of BRCA2, D2723H, fails to interact with DSS1 and is mislocalized to the cytoplasm due to an aberrantly exposed nuclear export signal.

functional_data.summary: The D2723H mutation affects the interaction with DSS1 and leads to mislocalization.

variants.additional_notes: The paper primarily focuses on the functional aspects of BRCA2 and its interactions rather than providing extensive variant data.
key_quotes: Moreover, a cancer-associated mutant of BRCA2, D2723H, fails to interact with DSS1 and is mislocalized to the cytoplasm due to an aberrantly exposed nuclear export signal.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided specific information about the D2723H variant in BRCA2.
